fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59188].
  {panel}

Hello, 

I need to automatically assign a ticket after a specific transition, the assigned group will so depend on a specific custom field that was set during the creation of the ticket.
When the user hit the transition "T" (awaiting approval (for exp), the post-function should perform this verification:

if CustomField X value = V1 then assign the ticket to group G1
if CustomField X value = V2 then assign the ticket to group G2.
if CustomField X value = V3 then assign the ticket to group G3.
Is there any plugin to JIRA that allows me to do such conditional assignment ? 
or should it be a scrypt inserted anywhere on the post function of the transition ?

SEN-543446

Regards,
fields.summary: A field depend to the result of  another field
Virtualizing JIRA page restricted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59183].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
Users have different JIRA email preferences. Some want more email, while others want less. The problem is that an admin determines the email preferences for all users. This results in spammy JIRA emails that get ignored.

h3. Story Point
* As a user, I'd like to specify that JIRA emails that I get

h3. Proposed Solution
*Email Based on Saved Filters*
Users already have the ability to write a query and save it as a filter. As an added feature, it would be nice to have a mail icon to specify email settings associated with that filter (see below).

_Proposed Mail Icons_
!Mail Settings.png|thumbnail!

In the Proposed Mail Icons (above), each color means something different:
* *{color:red}Red{color}* - No Email Preferences Configured / Do Not Send Me Email
* *{color:#14892c}Green{color}* - Email Preferences are Configured

*Activity Stream Style Settings*
In the Activity Stream, a user can setup certain filters. For example:

_Activity Stream Settings_
!Activity Stream Preferences.png|thumbnail!

I propose that if a user clicks the mail icon, then a similar menu appears. In this menu, users specifies one or more of the reasons to send a JIRA email. For Example, if a\(n):
* Comment is added
* Issue Created
* Issue Closed
* Issue is transitioned
* Issue Updated (field modified)

With this feature, a user can specify the JIRA emails that they get based on the saved filter.

*Display Options*
Custom fields are an important part of JIRA. Users will need the ability to specify which fields they want displayed in each email.
fields.summary: Email Settings based on Saved Filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59182].
  {panel}

Steps to replicate the problem:
# Create a project in JIRA
# Create an Issue related to that Project
# Create a webhook, which will trigger a build in Jenkins. In this webhook, write a JQL query as: * issuekey="AS-1" AND status changed FROM "In Review" TO "Done"* and tick mark the 'updated' checkbox under the *Issue* heading. 
# Create a workflow, (for example like: Create -> InProgress -> InReview -> Done)
# In the transition from InReview to Done, attach the webhook as a post function
# Create a workflow scheme, add the workflow created in above step to this workflow scheme
# Associate this workflow scheme to the project

Now, go to the issue, change the state from InProgress to InReview and then from InReview to Done. Since the webhook is attached to  the transition from InReview to Done, this fires the webhook. Again go to the respective issue and change its priority from Low to High, for example or add a comment to the issue. This will fire the webhook. So, basically any update in that issue, fires the webhook. The requirement is to make the webhook fire only when transition changes from InReview to Done and no other event/action.

Now, if you edit the webhook and untick the issue-updated checkbox and then repeat the steps mentioned above (first changing transition from InReview to Done, then updating any field in the issue), the webhook isnt fired.

So basically, we are unable to achieve the requirement, which is to create a webhook which should fire only on one event, i.e. a transition change, and it should not fire on any other  action/event/change in the issue. 

I couldnt devise a solution for this, even with JQL. Please look into this scenario and acknowledge back if its possible to achieve it in JIRA v6.4.12.

Also you can find attached a bit more detailed document with this post.

Thanks & Regards,
Ashish
fields.summary: Webhook cant be fired, if no event is checked

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59181].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 14 February 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

We have recently added support for this in JIRA Cloud with the release of a new JQL function called {{*parentEpic*}}. Searching with {{parentEpic}} will return all the issues in the specified epic(s) AND their sub-tasks. The syntax is a little bit different than a standard JQL functions – it's more like searching with a field. So

{{project = JRA and parentEpic = JRA-123}}

will return all issues and sub-tasks in the JRA project that are in the JRA-123 epic. The function also supports the != , IN , and NOT IN operators. So you could also search something like

{{project = JRA and parentEpic in (JRA-123, JRA-456)}}

and you will get all issues and sub-tasks in either the JRA-123 or JRA-456 epics.

[Refer to the documentation for more information|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-functions-reference-764478342.html#Advancedsearching-functionsreference-parentEpicparentEpic]. Happy searching!

*Note*: Currently we don't have a timeline on when this will be released in JIRA Server; however we will provide an update once we do.

Dave Meyer
Senior Product Manager, JIRA
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition
    As a manager I want to be able to filter all the issues related to a specific Epic. Right now it is not possible to filter the subtasks without using a third party for this purpose. I believe this is a common need and should be added to JIRA Standard JQL search.

h3. Suggested Solution
    Create a function to return all issues related to Epic, like the one provided by tempo {{parent in tempoEpicIssues(XXX-####, YYY-###, ZZZ-####)}}.
    This would allow searchs like: {{"Epic Link" in (XXX-####, YYY-###, ZZZ-####) OR parent in tempoEpicIssues(XXX-####, YYY-###, ZZZ-####)}}.
 
h3. Workaround
    Install and add-on to provide the list of issues in a given Epic so the above suggestion can be used.
    This thread talks about some options: [JQL to show all issues AND subtasks in the Epic|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/177329/jql-to-show-all-issues-and-subtasks-in-the-epic].
fields.summary: Ability search for all issues under a given Epic (including subtasks)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59178].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
Currently with the JIRA Installer release, we still provide users with outdated JAVA release. As for JIRA 7.0.5 the included JAVA is version 1.8u51. Since newer JAVA release contain important patches such as security patches (in version 1.8u66) it would be good idea to keep updating the JAVA version in each minor JIRA release.

*Suggested Solution*
Update JAVA versions in each JIRA Installer relase.

*Workaround*
It's possible for the users to manually upgrade the JAVA even though they are using the installer but it could be slightly complicated. Even if the user managed to update the JAVA, if the user update JIRA using the installer, JAVA will be overwritten with the 1 provided with the installer.
fields.summary: Update JAVA in JIRA Installer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59175].
  {panel}

*Suggestion Description*
As an Admin, I have certain users on my JIRA instance that require a persistent session(no timeout), however we would need to restrict the change to just specific users.

*Actually Available*
- There currently exist a feature that lets you customize the timeout however this is system wide as seen here:
-* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira062/changing-the-default-session-timeout-588581487.html

*Expected*
- Add a feature so the Admin can control session timeout per user.
fields.summary: Add ability to configure individual user Session Timeout

*Suggested Solution*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59143].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There is a need for further clarifications in the JIRA REST API Reference:
# https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/version-createVersion
#* Here the request parameter: *"archived": false,* and *"released": true,* are given. However, these values cannot be set during version creation. As with the UI, a version has to go through stages, where it first will have to be created. Then a created version can be *released* and then a *released* version may be *Archived*. Therefore this customer can only create with the above REST API. They will have to use the update REST call to update the version to released and then again to archive. 
#* User should either pass  "releaseDate" or "userReleaseDate", not both.
# https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/issue-editIssue
#* As explained in this JAC comment: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-224338?focusedCommentId=5839137&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-583913, clarify the process of updating fixVersions using the above REST API.

h3. Suggested Solution
Clarify the above in the documentation.
fields.summary: As a user, I want the JIRA REST API Reference to be clearer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59140].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
User is experiencing an issue where  when they attempt to open a file exported from JIRA by double clicking on the file or dragging the file into an open excel instance, the file fails to open.
- The described methods open other .xls files.
User would need to use the {{File > Open > Select your file}} option provided from the file menu to open the issue to which they receive the following warning:
{code}The file format and the file extension of 'cup work done (projektflusterei jira) -2-2.xls not match. possibly the file is damaged or not sure. You should not open if you do not trust its source. Let them open the file anyway{code}

*Platform*
* JIRA 7.0.2
* Office 365 and Excel 2016.

*Steps to reproduce*
- Search for issues in your JIRA issue navigator.
- Export the selected issues using the Excel(columns) option
- Double click the exported file to open it in Excel or drag the file into an Excel from office 365

*Scenario One*
{panel}
*Expected behavior*
The file is opened with no errors or warnings.

*Actual Behavior*
The file is not opened
{panel}

*Scenario 2: Open via File menu Excel 2016*
{panel}
*Expected behavior*
The file is opened with no errors or warnings.

*Actual Behavior*
The file is opened but with the following warning.

{code}
The file format and the file extension of 'Cup Work done (projektflusterei jira) -2-2.xls not match. possibly the file is damaged or not sure. You should not open if you do not trust its source. Let them open the file anyway
{code}

!PastedGraphic-1.png!
fields.summary: Security Warning When Opening Exported Excel files from JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59138].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no way to sort the version (as in Unreleased and Released) under the affect version field.

For now, the Released versions are always placed on top of the list of Affect Version/s field.

There are customers would prefer to have the Unreleased version to be listed on top of the list under the  Affect Version/s field.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to sort the list in Affect Version/s field.
fields.summary: sort version in affect version field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59136].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Comments in JIRA have a link at the top right of the comment box with a chain icon, that links to that specific comment when clicked. In Chrome v47, clicking on this won't focus on the comment. It will be highlighted but the user still needs to scroll manually through the page to find it.

h3. Environment
* Chrome Version 47
* JIRA 7.1
Works normally in JIRA 7.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue with multiple comments
# Click on the Chain icon.

*Expected Results:* The page refreshes and the comment is in focus on the screen and highlighted. 
Actual Results:* The page refreshes but the comment is only highlighted.
No errors in the Browser console

h3. Notes
It works as expected in Firefox
fields.summary: Comment links don't focus on Comment when clicked
Ability to select inactive users in an User Picker
On Issue Navigator, create an option to sort by number of comments the results of searches.
Show the percentage of estimation in Issue View Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59125].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Admins receive email notification only when 
- An add-on license has expired
- Maintenance for an add-on has expired
- A user requests an add-on (system administrators only)
- A user updates the add-on request (system administrators only)

Admins do not receive email notification when there's an update available for the installed add-ons.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admins to receive email notification when there's an update available for the installed add-ons.

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Email notification for add-ons available update
Allow description and comment fields unlimited text (no character limit)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59123].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

As the number of issues that exist in Jira grows, it will be become more and more difficult to find the desired issue to link to.
h3. Solution
 * It would be better if the issue link drop-down shows only the issues within same project
 * OR if an administrator could restrict the auto complete to issues that match a specific JQL filter on a per project basis.
fields.summary: Ability To Restrict The 'Issue Link' Field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59121].
  {panel}

Current Behavior:
Smart Query has, on more than one occasion, ruined a perfectly good search with its smartness.

There have been zero occasions where I have found it useful.

For example, if I search for "duplicate x", I want to find bugs in my software where something is getting duplicated. IE, "duplicate records" or "duplicate users" or "duplicate locations".

I am not looking for JIRA issues that are duplicate. And by automagically changing my filter to issue type of duplicate is just wrong.

Desired Behavior:
Add a feature to turn this silliness off.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In the Search Box in the upper right hand corner, type in "Duplicate something".
2. Search.
3. Note that a filter has been set for Duplicate Issues.
Thanks
fields.summary: Disabling Smart Query in JIRA would be helpful
Token is getting rejected upon logging in to UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59116].
  {panel}

*Suggestion Summary*
A user may want to export issues at the end of each month for records and having to do the process manually seems taxing.

Can a feature be added into JIRA that allows a user set queries that it needs to generate results for from the issue navigation page and automatically export the returned result in the format selected by the user?

*Current*
This feature is unavailable in JIRA with the only available means being to send notification for saved filters the user has subscribed to.

*Expected*
A feature in JIRA that lets JIRA generate the result and automatically export the issues returned as results to a format the customer specified when configuring the feature.
fields.summary: Add Feature to Automate Query and Export to Excel or PDF of Issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59114].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
# For some reason, customers decided to change the  primary email of Google apps users, from lastname@mycompany.com to firstname.lastname@mycompany.com.
# User accidentally created GApps user with firstnameLastname, but the actual one should be firstname.lastname

When admin tries to edit the username for GApps user, system prompts the message:
{noformat} XXX is a Google Apps user and cannot be renamed {noformat}
This is quite troublesome if recreate a new account for the GApps user as there are many issues, comments, permissions, and etc, associated with this user.

h3. Suggested Solution
Since the ability to edit usernames is released from JIRA 6.0 [JRA-1549|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-1549], hope that this feature is available for GApps users as well.
fields.summary: Ability to Edit Username for GApps Users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59098].
  {panel}

h3. Summary:
If we click the "Download" button, rather than being redirected to our website download page, it will be better if it just download it from JIRA UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Login as admin
# Navigate to _JIRA Administration Page > Applications > Versions & Licenses_
# On JIRA Core section, click the "Download" button.
(i) button will be only available if there is newer release for JIRA Core
# There will be a pop-up with list of the installer that the user get.
# Click "Get Installer"

h3. Current Result:
# The user will be redirected to Atlassian Website JIRA Core download page.

h3. Desired Result:
# Like any other Applications, it will automatically download the installer from the UI, even though it is not possible to update automatically like other application.
# A pop-up after downloading the installer will be great. The pop-up will include information about how to upgrade JIRA.

h3. Important Notes:
# This particular page is also confusing the User.
 !Download Page.png|thumbnail! 
# They will thought that to upgrade JIRA Core( or JIRA platform) a license is needed.
# Even though, *clicking Download will download the installer without the need of a license*
fields.summary: Automatically Download JIRA Core installer from the Versions & Licenses page

Hi everybody!
It could be perfect if into add into change history information not only about the fact of issue creation, but also about values of field.
Why it is requared:
* it helps to find initial value of a field
* helps to understand wether a issue was created or cloned (some times users delete respective link)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59079].
  {panel}

If the same custom field name is used in several projects for a custom field and custom fields are distinct (e.g. projects do not share fields configuration), issue search produces incorrect results for the following request:

"custom field" is EMPTY

Namely, issues with non-empty values for "custom field" are returned as well.

The following requests

cf[10201] is EMPTY
-or-
"custom field" is EMPTY AND Project="prj"

does not work as well (include issues with non-empty custom field values).

The only way to workaround is to use the following jql:

cf[10201] is EMPTY AND Project="prj"

This is definitely a bug and should be fixed.
fields.summary: "custom field" is EMPTY does not work if "custom field" is used in several projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59073].
  {panel}

I tried to make a request to the following rest resource:

 !Screen Shot 2015-12-21 at 8.07.38 am.png|thumbnail! 

And got a 404. When I looked through the JIRA source code I could not even see that resource implemented in com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.admin.WorkflowsResource

However, it is documented in the pubilic JIRA documentation as though it exists: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/workflow-getProperties

What is wrong? The documentation or the source code. I'm writing the documenation around entity properties for Atlassian Connect right now so this will affect those docs.

Note: I am developing with AMPS and my JIRA version is v7.1.0-OD-02-025#71001-sha1:64a64e8. I have also tried browsing with the Rest API Browser and don't see the documented rest resources from there either. Cheers.
fields.summary: Missing documented workflow properties rest api.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59067].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if you want to set assignee or reporter for an issue, the autocomplete suggestions only show users which start with the letter typed and not if the letter is contained in the username. 
Eg: 
Username: vm-john
where the user would like to type *john* in either the assignee or reporter field and get *vm-john* as a recommendation. However, currently only usernames that begin with *john* are included. 

h4. Notes
* This feature is not found for the assignee and reporter field
* This is found in the user management page when searching for a user.

h3. Suggested Solution
Give the ability to search within and not only from the starting of a username, possible by having the wildcard both at the start and the end of the username.
fields.summary: As a User, I want user search to be more flexible

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian,

in relation to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-34458 we have the same problem with JIRA (Server) in versions 7.0.4 (and 7.0.5 since today).

Could you check the published versions and builds of JIRA in the marketplace?

Thank you in advance,
Timo Reinbold
fields.summary: This version of JIRA is unrecognized by the Atlassian Marketplace. It might be a non-standard build or be too new to appear.
Allow screens to be restricted by a user group

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59063].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Date and time custom field can be displayed in an JIRA Issue. The time will be displayed based on the Timezone of the user viewing the issue. This works fine but maybe for instance the user travels a lot and will constantly have to update timezone. Sometimes this can be forgotten

h3. Suggestion
Add the timezone beside the date and time custom fields (in both viewing it or when editing the value as well)
fields.summary: Add Timezone beside date/time picker

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59061].
  {panel}

{noformat}

Most email clients don't send the NUL character as they have no way for users to input this character in. This problem was found to happen when receiving Email Campaigns that are sent using scripts or programs.

h3. Environment:
JIRA
Postgres DB

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a JIRA mail handler
# Send an email with the character {{NUL}} (0x00) as part of the Description
*Expected Result:* JIRA corrects the {{NUL}} character unsupported by postgres and creates the issue normally
*Actual Result:* JIRA fails to create the issue and keeps attempting to create it every 1 minute.

This bug also causes: [JRA-38024|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-38024] - JIRA increments pcounter when UTF encoding errors occurs
fields.summary: ERROR: invalid byte sequence for encoding "UTF8": 0x00 prevents creation of issues by email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59060].
  {panel}

Steps:
1. Create a JIRA issue
2. Click on "Comment" button and select "Browse" under the Clip icon to add attachment 
3. Select any image from your local and click Add

Expected result
1. That image can be added successfully to that JIRA issue
2. That image is rendered as inline image in the comment successfully 

Actual result
1. That image can be added successfully to that JIRA issue with a successful fly message in right hand side
2. That image is NOT rendered in the comment successfully, ERROR message is shown there and also error in the console.
* Note: refresh that JIRA issue can solve the problem, or just wait 2-3 minutes that image can be rendered as normal
fields.summary: Unable to render attachment in a JIRA issue comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59059].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Unable to paste image during issue creation on Safari.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# snap a screen shoot/copy an image from your machine
# Click Create button (create issue pop-up window will appear);
# Click into the Description field;
# Ctrl + V to paste in the image

h3. Expected Results
- Image should be attached to the issue and a reference inserted into the Description field

h3. Actual Results
- Image is not be attached

h3. Workaround
# Attach image to issue
# Create issue
# insert image into description
fields.summary: Unable to paste image into description during issue creation on Safari
Implement a "user in group" validator for the create issue transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59054].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Searching for a value in fields with multiple values behaves in a way consistent with formal logic, but confusing for users relying on common sense.

h3. Suggest Solution

We introduce a new _contains_ operator for list/multi-valued types along with the existing _=_ ,_is_ and _in_ operators. The _contains_ operator has the same semantics as the _in_ or _=_ operator except when negated.

h3. Workaround

There is no current workaround.
fields.summary: As a JIRA end user, I want to search for explicitly defined subsets of a list of options

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59052].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
I would like to be able to hide fields (e.g. Fix Version/s) from all users but still able to update the field via workflow transition.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update more fields with the post-functions, or introduce field security

h3. Workaround
Use add-ons
fields.summary: Update hidden fields with post-functions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59050].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, JIRA Health Check will calculate everything in indexes directory to count whether it has enough free space or not. This means, this also count the index folder created by third party plugin. 

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option for JIRA Health Check to calculate what belongs to JIRA only, and exclude the indexes from third party plugin.
fields.summary: Health Check should only count index of JIRA
As a user, I would like to have JIRA Mobile application

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59048].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
* As a user, in the comment field, at this moment, if you are not allowed to edit the field, there is no way for you to copy over the text together with the styling (bold,colour, etc)
* This would be difficult and inefficient to recreate all the styling again.

h3. Suggested Solution
 * To allow code style to be copied over as well when a text is copy from the text field in JIRA using the copy function
fields.summary: As a user, to have ability to copy text from text field together with codestyle

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59047].
  {panel}

https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/rest/api/2/issue/RP-93 returns result with non-null reporter
https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/rest/api/2/search?jql=key%3DRP-93 returns null reporter

Username in the reporter field actually does not exist ( https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/rest/api/2/user?username=mychin )

(Initally raised as https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/REST-365, but the issue was suggested to be raised in JIRA)
fields.summary: Inconsistent responses between /api/2/issue and /api/2/search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59046].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When selecting the Add-ons tab in JIRA Administration, it will leads to Find new add-ons page.

However in other Atlassian products such as Confluence/Bamboo/Fisheye, selecting the same command will leads you to the Manage add-ons page instead.

h3. Suggested Solution
JIRA should have the same behaviour same with other Atlassian products.

h3. Workaround 
Temporary manually click on the Manage add-ons page instead.
fields.summary: inconsistency when clicking on the Add-ons
Time out on TFS4JIRA check-in search on changesets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59042].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently there is no way to export the UPM audit log. It is handy to have an export the audit log for reporting purposes. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Provide export function for UPM audit log.
fields.summary: Provide export function for UPM Audit log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59041].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

There is no search function for UPM Audit log. It is tedious to find a specific event log without a search function.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide search function for UMP audit log.
fields.summary: Search function for UPM Audit log

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 25 Sept. 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi,

This appears to be a Support request for Jira Server and the issue has not get additional activity since it reported so I'll be closing it.

If you have further questions please contact us at support.atlassian.net

Cheers,

Eric
{panel}
Hi,

Hoping you can help I have created new release versions in JIRA for 2016. However these versions and proposed release versions are not appearing in all users drop downs as they did previously.

Drop down fields I would expect to see these Requested Release Month / Archived Affects Versions. Requested Release Month etc.

Can someone please look into this and revert it must be due to a setting which I have failed to apply but I cannot tell.

[http://ent01-jira.bankofamerica.com:8081/browse/REG/?selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:summary-panel]
fields.summary: Versions & Proposed Versions Not Appearing in drop down fields as expected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59039].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently my GMAIL account blocks my email notifications as spam because the same message is being sent out to multiple different recipients.

h3. Suggested Solution

Have the option to send notifications in one message with the recipients in BCC  to avoid this behavior.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I would like my e-mail notifications to be send as one message with the recipients in BCC

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59037].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The watcher functionality cannot be disabled
h3. Suggested Solution
Add a checkbox in the system administration to disable watchers.
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like to disable the Watcher functionality

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59033].
  {panel}

As a JIRA user, I would like to easily create hyperlinks to JIRA issues that include both the key and the summary so that I can easily paste them into other documents and systems.

Currently I use the Export to Word functionality and copy the top line of that export in Word which contains both the JIRA key and the JIRA summary and a hyperlink to the JIRA.  It would be nice to have an action on the issue that would place just that link onto the clipboard without having to go through the export to WORD step.

Thanks for your consideration.
Berkley
fields.summary: As a JIRA user, I would like to easily create hyperlinks to JIRA issues that include both the key and the summary so that I can easily paste them into other documents and systems.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59032].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
After configuring the default configuration scheme for a Custom Field with context defined for all issue types and all projects, if performing a search filtering for that Custom Field using Basic Search, the following message is returned: "Field is not applicable for the current project and/or issue type"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Administration > Issues > Custom Fields
# Add a Custom Field named "Test"
# Navigate to that Custom Field, then go to Cog Icon > Configure
# Edit the Applicable contexts for scheme with the following:
Issue Types: Any issue type
Check "Apply to issues under selected projects" then select all projects.
# Try searching for issues using that Custom Field on Basic Search

h3. Expected Results
No warnings about the context of that Custom Field

h3. Actual Results
A warning is shown on the UI: "Field is not applicable for the current project and/or issue type".

h3.Workaround
Using Global context on the Custom Field configuration makes the behaviour not reproducible anymore.
fields.summary: Custom Field context not behaving correctly.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59031].
  {panel}

Related to support request JST-171202

Basically, if a jira project and a confluence space are linked, all confluence updates seem to show up on the jira issue activity tab. Even if no explicit link between the page updated on confluence and the issue exists.
This is very strange behaviour in my opinion and could be considered a bug. This is also not documented behaviour.

What would be more acceptable would be that there is a link to the confluence space from the project (sidebar) in our opinion.
fields.summary: All updates of a confluence space that is linked to an issue's project, are shown in the activity tab of the issue
Project -> progress tracking got error.
Can not view JIRA Projects.

fields.description:
Hi Team,

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59025].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When the mail handler fails to attach an attachment from an email to an issue, the following comment will be added to the issue
bq. An error occurred while adding attachments to this issue from the source email. Please check the attachments and re-send the email

In some cases, the attachment is just an email signature which does not need to be added and the auto-comment is not relevant

h3. Suggestion
Have the option to enable/disable this auto-comment.
fields.summary: Disable auto-comment when attachment from email fails to be attached
Accessibility: Dropdown Menus aren't accessible (JAWS/NVDA)
Allow editing of announcement banner directly on any page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59022].
  {panel}

 !image-2015-12-15-15-38-04-062.png|thumbnail! 

Using JIRA Portfolio, hosted on premises.
Teams are grouped by function: Android, iOS, etc
The story is being created under an epic to represent Android team effort.
The team is overbooked by XX percent in the sprint but the story would not spill over to the next sprint and would not push other tasks out.
Is this a correct behavior?
fields.summary: JIRA Portfolio: team is overbooked but the story would not spill over to the next sprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59021].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently if JIRA if an attachment is not available in the attachments home directory, the JIRAs Health Checker would give an error message that the error message cannot be read. 

Other known reasons for this error message is due to permission issues in the directory.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the error message specific, like attachment cannot be eg " Attachment does not exist in filesystem". Therefore customers can easily diagnose and fix these issues when they see this error from the Health Checker.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want Health Checker to specifically say if an attachment cannot be found rather than say "cannot be read"
How to use System JRE Documentation Outdated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59015].
  {panel}

We have internal file servers (ftp://, smb://, etc.), as well as custom web-based applications (Seapine Test Track, for example, using ttstudio:// formatting) which have web integration using various URI schemes.

 !image-2015-12-15-15-00-42-857.png|thumbnail! 

We would like to be able to link JIRA issues to these other applications and services using custom web links (which works fine using HTML macros in Confluence, for example.) But the Link validation script only appears to accept http and https. Likewise, the rich formatting in JIRA issues only seems to recognize certain schemes. (See links above.)

Can this be modified somehow?
fields.summary: URL Handlers - Only http/https schemes allowed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59014].
  {panel}

h5. Definition
Currently the JIRA Audit log does not register whenever an issue link type is modified, deleted or created.

h5. Suggestion
Register on audit log any actions performed for issue link types
fields.summary: Audit log should register when an issue link type is created

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59013].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When embedding videos using JIRA's wiki markup (example below), the video automatically starts playing when opening the issue. 

h3. Suggested Solution 
Add options to autoplay or mute videos as possible with the [video HTML5|http://www.w3schools.com/html/html5_video.asp] tag.
fields.summary: As a JIRA User, I'd like to have more options when embedding videos

fields.description:
For some users in our Jira, the users filter in the issue overview of a project does not work.
We even gave them admin role for the project to exclude restriction problems.

The issue overview is not useable without proper filtering.
fields.summary: User filter not avaliable for some users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59010].
  {panel}

Please consider the below changes

* Let user himself decide which notifications to receive
* Support email digesting (e.g. merge consequent changes into one notiifcation message)
* In each email, show the reason why it has been received, with link to personal notification settings page

This all will make JIRA really good enterprise-level product. Lot of products have such functionality.
fields.summary: JIRA notification system improvement

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

!Edit_Issue.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.summary: Show already linked issues in Edit Issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59000].
  {panel}

Hi there,

We had an issue with our SD where tickets sent from email is not going through and not creating any tickets.

The last ticket sent had an error attaching an image. And then after that we receive this error and this was the last one in the processing log

Exception when MailHandlerWorker handles message: com.sun.mail.util.DecodingException: BASE64Decoder: Error in encoded stream: needed 4 valid base64 characters but only got 2 before EOF, the 10 most recent characters were: "XXH4zTOPR7"

Can you please help.

Cheers
Ron
fields.summary: tickets sent from email not going to the service desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-58999].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The default filters on the top of Statistic View of JIRA Software projects points to empty results.
!Screenshot 1.png|thumbnail! !Screenshot 2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Project View > Statistic View
# Click on any filter on the top; eg: All issues

h3. Expected Results
Issues Navigator page is showing the matching issues.
Example URL to search *All issues* for a project: {noformat}https://example.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=project+%3D+<pkey>{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
Issues Navigator page is showing _no issues_ because of duplicated words */issues/?* in the URL.
Example URL to search *All issues* for a project in actual: {noformat}https://example.atlassian.net/issues/?/issues/?jql=project+%3D+<pkey>{noformat}

h3.Workaround
# Right click the desired link
# Choose *Copy link address*
# Paste the link on new tab
# Delete one of the */issues/?* from the url
# Press "Enter"
fields.summary: Filter Links in Statistic View are Broken
Update Documentation to Reflect Removed Attach Screenshot Button
Customise default filters in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-57506].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
JIRA do not support searching words in Issue using partial word search.

This especially affect language such as German. For example:

If a Issue created created in JIRA where the default language is German:

Summary -> "Mehrmandantenfähigkeit für Clients und Reports"
Description -> "Man muss Clients und Reports pro Veranstaltung anlegen/verwalten können, da momentan noch nicht Mehrmandantenfähig."

Searching using partial word such as "Mehr" or "mehr" will not show the previous issue in the issue navigator.

*Suggested Solution*
Add partial foreign word search in JIRA. 

*Workaround*
Currently there are no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Search Issue using partial words
Date picker problem
